Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2012 06:31AM jabal wrote: The radiologist called me today to tell me it was indeed invasive small cancer.  The only other thing she told me was that it was EStrogen and Progesterone (I hope I got that right) positive.  She said I would meet with surgeon in the morning.  I have spent several hours reading posts on here and am more confused than ever.  How do you all keep this stuff straight? I thought I knew what questions to ask for initial visit but now my mind is jello.  She did say I should have surgery asap, probably lumpectomy .  All I know is I will wake up tomorrow and then do the same the next day.  You all have such positive attitudes and I normally do.  I look forward to getting to that place. Thanks again
Posts.Title: New and scared jabal DC197

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2012 11:28PM jabal wrote: Well I guess today was an indication of what life will be like for awhile.  I went in for labs, EKG, and chest Xray, made an appt to see a nurse to discuss what to expect from surgery, got a call from Oncology wanting to see me in next 3 days, and all the time trying to work because I have no sick time.  I did not see any bio on you but without prying if you would like to share your story I would like to hear like when where you diagnosed, surgery, etc. I would help me I think to hear someone elses story.  But you if you don't I will understand.  I am just grateful you are helping me through this.  Thanks for the tips on hot flashes...I will try anything! Hugs
Posts.Title: New and scared jabal DC197

Posts.Content: jabal wrote: Thankful to have found this site.  I went in for routine mammo and was called back for more pictures.  The found a 5mm lump in my right breast after an ultrasound.  I then went in for a biopsy.  During the biopsy the radiologist said she knew it was cancer after looking at all my pictures and the ultrasound.  She said the shape and calcium deposits is what made her make this determination.  She set up an appointment with a surgeon for next Tuesday to discuss my biopsy results.  From what I have read it seems radiologists make this determination all the time before the results are in.  I guess they know what they are talking about?  Of course I am scared.  I have been doing so much reading my head is spinning with fear.  Some say catching it at such a small size is good although not always the case.  I have been on hormone patches for 20 years since I had a full hysterectomy.  The day I was told I needed a biospy I went off the patch cold turkey.  that was a few weeks ago now......just in the last week my left breast and armpit are always sore.  I am hoping it is from going off the patch but now in fear of more symptoms of cancer in the other breast although the mammo showed nothing on that one.  I had no symptoms of any kind prior to the routine mammo, no pain, no soreness, no nothing.  I wonder if my mind is creating all the new symptoms.  I am rambling but I am sure you are used to this from new members.  There are moments when I feel strong and moments I am not sure I could do anything except start walking in a straight line some where and never stopping.  I would appreciate any comments ....thank you for listening Dx 12/11/2012, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New and scared jabal DC197

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2012 07:42AM jabal wrote: Dear Broken dreams... thank you so much for your quick reply.  I will post on Tuesday.  You know in your head as a normal person when a doctor gives you such news before biopsy report done this is not professional.  but she did, so I am left with the fear that she placed upon me.  She even said "I hate to give such bad news during the holidays".  Thanks again and you will hear from me soon.......replying so soon to my post truly shows you are a caring person!
Posts.Title: New and scared jabal DC197

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2012 03:11AM jabal wrote: thank you Diane, Only two more days until my appointment to go over the results of the biopsy.  It is amazing what the mind can put you through.  To add to it I went cold turkey off HRT and now my left breast (mammo was fine) has bad pain and underarm pain as well non stop.  My imagination is going wild.  I am thinking it is because I am now getting no estrogen at all and have had none for weeks. I had a complete hysterectomy 20 years ago.   I thought the only symptom would be the heat flush.  the breast I had the biopsy on does not hurt at all except the entrance site.  Now I have myself all worried about the "good breast" that is killing me with discomfort.  It is the not knowing that is the worst.  I thank you for your kind words and I will post again on Tuesday when I get the results. Hugggssss back Jill
Posts.Title: New and scared jabal DC197

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2012 07:35AM jabal wrote: Wow Diane, reading your post was like you were in the dr's office with me today because you repeated exactly what he said.  I am 59 and had a hysterectomy 20 years ago on HRT ever since. Had to stop that and symptoms are horrible.  My good breast hurts and the armpit also.  My back hurts and just pain about everywhere.  No pain anywhere until I stopped the HRT's.  The second I found out I had cancer I took the patch off cold turkey.  I can't find any info on these symptoms from stopping therapy but can't imagine what else it could be. The doctor said because the cancer was so small they could not get enough tissue to give me many details other than what you mentioned.  I have the lumpectomy Tuesday and he will do the node you mentioned.  He was optimistic and said probably radiation and meds.  I know nothing about radiation, but it doesnt sound good.  I talked to an 86 yr old woman today who had lumpectomy 20 years ago and they wanted her to do radiation and she said no.  She has had no reoccurance of cancer.  There are so many variables.  I guess  I will just wait until after surgery.  Yes, I get out the same day and go home.  You know the mind is a crazy thing.  I went in feeling fit as a fiddle to get a routine mammo and now after this every inch of my body hurts in one way or the other.  The only place not bothering me is the breast that is bad.  I did get some anxiety meds because I was off the charts with worry and although I have never had anxiety attacks felt them coming on...a feeling of doom and death.  They help.  I will let you know how surgery goes and thanks again for responding...oh geeeezzzz another hot flash   grrrrrrrrrrrrrr   Any insight into above symptoms after quiting HRT let me know
Posts.Title: New and scared jabal DC197

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2012 11:43AM jabal wrote: doctor said all normal I guess from sentinal node dissection.  I guess the lump will go away.  Hurts like hell though

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2012 12:31AM jabal wrote: I will ask my oncologist.  I will have a new one.  The last one just said "it looks fine" and my surgeon said "it is normal".  Nothing that feels like this is normal to me.  I do the exercises but yes, I am also afraid of it turning into something worse.  Pain takes your mind to a new place and it is bad enough dealing with cancer without this.
Posts.Title: sentinal node dissection/pain lump..help! jabal shianne29

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2013 01:56AM jabal wrote: When I mentioned my cording and showed it to my onco and every other doctor they looked at me like they had no idea what I was talking about and still have not acknowledged it.  Luckily for me after almost two months it is all but gone on its own.
Posts.Title: sentinal node dissection/pain lump..help! jabal shianne29

Posts.Content: jabal wrote:  Hello everyone, if this hits home with any of you please respond I had lumpectomy and sentinal node dissection 4 days ago.  Besides a huge amount of bruising my incisions look fine but.....today my armpit started bothering me with pain.  I lifted my arm to see this long shaped swollen area that hurts like heck.  I was desperate and in a panic thinking "what has gone wrong" and saw a post where someone mentioned "cording".  If I had not found this post I would not ever heard of this word.  It actually looks like a cord under my skin right in my armpit leading up from the node incision.  Could this be my problem?  Do I call the doctor (things always happen on the weekend) do I apply ice or anything to it?  Do I do some kind of exercise? Help!  Everything freaks me out these days...... Dx 12/11/2012, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2012 12:18PM jabal wrote: Thanks to all of you for responding.  It is worse today. Just sore as heck.  I have tried some stretching but painful.  My breast also gets shooting pains in the nipple.  I assume this is nerve healing?  I don't know but from what all of you have said it is normal.  The bruising is about gone and the incisions are healing nicely.  I just wish I knew what to do about chemo vs radiation and the pill.  I have lots more research to do and now that I have asked for a new oncologist (kaiser) I hope I will get more information before making my decision.  I know the sentinal node was positive but everything else on pathology points to stage 1 slow cell division and growing.  I don't know..........tough decision.  Thank you all and any more thoughts you have please share.   Happy Holidays to all of you!

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2012 01:38PM jabal wrote: Rebecca, can I ask you a question....it seemed that with your stage and grade of cancer you would not need a matectomy.  If not too personal can I ask why?  My cording problem is worse today.  Getting longer and moving down my arm.  My doctor said normal.  I have full range of movement without much pain a week after my lumpectomy but boy it sure is sore.  I hope it will go away soon?  I meet with oncology for the first time tomorrow.  I have a feeling what the outcome will be but I want to think of it as an information gathering appointment.  Take one moment at a time I guess to mentally make it through.  You all seem so brave.  I hope I can get there. Thanks for replying to you all.

Posts.Content: jabal wrote: Saw my oncologist for the first time today.  This is what she said With your type of cancer (stage 2a grade 1 Estrogen + Prog + Her2 - 1 node positive) your options are do nothing with a 25% chance of it coming back, with radiation and the pill for 5 yrs 16% chance of it coming back and with all of the above and chemo 9 % chance of it coming back.  She asked if my surgeon was going to other node checks other than the sentinal dissection he did.  I told her he said no, not necessary and sent me to you to talk about chemo.  She said they don't believe that chemo is always necessary for my level of cancer so suggested a "trial" they are doing (kaiser) where I would be picked to either do chemo or just the pill.  She then typed a letter to my surgeon asking him to go back in to look at more nodes.  I finally got out of her the criteria for the trial is they have to have at least 4 nodes with cancer.  Awwww now I get it, she is recommending surgery more to have me qualify for the trial.  I was not happy.  What do you think of all that? Also,  I just thought of something.....would they know if I got breast cancer from the node or the other way round.  I would think that would make a lot of difference and they would have told me if that were the case? Also has anyone had a test called onco type dx?  I hear it is something we should have?  Also, is it normal to put all this off as they tell me until I heal from my lumpectomy?  I hate to wait a month for any treatment.  I want to get rid of this now.  I am so confused about chemo vs a pill...any insight or thoughts any of you have I would appreciate.  I trust the women in this forum more than doctors at this point.  Hugs to all of you for being there Dx 12/11/2012, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: jabal wrote: Was not sure where to post these questions but here goes. appreciate any thoughts from others.  I finished my radiation in April.  Got through it like a breeze.  Started arimadex.  Had to start and stop many times because it seemed the side effects were horrible and they mostly stopped when I quit.  For weeks now I have had so much breast pain, armpit pain, tenderness in spots that come and go, chest pain, anxiety.  I had one node taken out that was positve but seemed isolated to that node.  The strange thing is my good breast has the same discomfort.  It is like my entire chest area from armpit to armpit hurts off and on including my ribs, back and on and on.  My oncologist keeps putting me off and just wants to see me for my 6 month checkup in September.  He finally set me up to see a surgeon next week to see if any biopsy needs to be done.  This darn anxiety is through the roof.  Could this be from the rads?  The surgery?  Scar tissue? infection?  Another strange this is that I was told the breast would get smaller due to rads and the fact they took out tissue when they did the lumpectomy.  My breast is actually larger again?  I thought at first it was the hormone therapy but stopped it and it still goes on.  Has anyone experienced this from rads?  I was so good for several months after rads so can it rear it's ugly head later?  The entire upper half of my body hurst like hell...help Dx 12/11/2012, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: pain pain and more pain jabal Linda-n3
